content.description: Third route from the left. A little bit of a tricky start, then easier ground above. Clean rock and climbing.  Shares anchor with Dead Raven Crack.
content.location: Third route from the left. Just left of the obvious offwidth crack (Dead Raven Crack) that splits the formation.

content.description: Excellent, fun climbing on positive cramps and an exciting move to the anchor. Wish it was longer.
content.location: First route to the right of Dead Raven Crack.

content.description: The rightmost route at the crag. Surmounts a small bulge a few feet up, then another little bulge before then anchor.
content.location: Rightmost route at the crag. Just uphill from Roadrunner Tracks.

content.description: The leftmost route at the crag. Goes straight up to a crux bulge at mid-height, then traverses up and right to a final bulge and the anchor.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

content.description: Takes the direct line up the center portion of the left side of the Aviary. Good, consistent climbing on good rock. Too bad it's not longer.
content.location: The second route from the left at the Aviary. This is the center line of three routes that are left of the off width crack.

content.description: Follows the obvious off width crack in the middle of the formation. Start with a short move (can place small cams here if needed) up to 2 bolts which protect the widest part of the crack. Then use wide gear to protect the next few moves. Medium cams work fine for the final bit to the anchor. It's helpful to have at least one #5, #6 or #7 cam to protect the wide section. This route is also easily top-roped after doing Tanager Tango to the left, since they share the same anchor.
content.protection: Small selection of cams up to #5 or #6 (even a #7 works). 2 bolts protect the widest part of the crack. Quick lower anchors.
content.location: The obvious wide crack in the center of the formation.

content.description: This crag has good rock, fun climbing, moderate grades and a fantastic hang with a view of a waterfall (when the water is running). The crag is split by an off width crack (Dead Raven Crack), which offers an easy trad route for those with some big cams. All other routes are bolted with quick lower anchors. The short crag makes it pretty easy to do all of these climbs in one outing.
